components.cBody: Defines what is meant by a problem space and a Governance Paradigm.
Defines an initial list of problems that will need to be solved in order for there to be a complete Governance Paradigm.
Defines MIPs and MIP Sets as the method used to amend or replace the Governance Paradigm.
A process component that provides a method and a template for adjusting the problem space.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP1 defines and describes Governance Paradigms and problem spaces.
items.paragraphSummary: A Governance Paradigm is a complete and specific group of MIP Sets that solves an entire problem space. A problem space is defined as a list of issues that must be addressed in order for the Maker Protocol to be able to sustain itself and grow into the future Maker governance.
items.title: Maker Governance Paradigms

components.cBody: Defines the first interim phase, in which the feedback period and freeze period for MIPs are ignored until 3 months after a core governance framework and a functional collateral onboarding process are implemented through MIPs.
Defines the second interim phase, in which the feedback period and freeze period for MIPs are reduced until the initial problem space has been addressed.
Defines the obsolescence of this MIP once the interim phases have passed.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP2 details two interim phases during which logic defined in MIP0 is overridden.
items.paragraphSummary:
This proposal details the process of how Maker Governance can bootstrap the setup and implementation of the first Governance Paradigm. More specifically, it defines two phases:1. **Phase 1:** when a core governance framework is put in place and a functional collateral onboarding process is ratified.
2. **Phase 2:** when the Problem Space is in the process of being addressed with MIPs and MIP Sets.

Lastly, the proposal states that MIP2 itself will become obsolete when the Problem Space has officially been addressed.
items.title: Launch Period

components.cBody: Suggests the purpose of the amendment and removal processes and possible reasons for using each process.

components.cTitle: Amendment Process for MIPs Older than 3 Months
components.cBody: A process component which defines a method and template for the amendment of an accepted MIP older than 3 Months.

components.cTitle: Amendment Process for MIPs Younger than 3 Months
components.cBody: A process component which defines a method and template for the amendment of an accepted MIP younger than 3 Months.
A process component which defines a method and template for the removal of an accepted MIP.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP4 defines processes for the amendment and removal of accepted MIPs.
items.paragraphSummary: The Amendment and Removal Process-MIP outlines the process for very small and relatively superficial changes to MIPs. This MIP Contains two Process Components, the first dealing with the Removal of ratified MIPs, and the second dealing with Amending current active MIPs.
items.title: MIP Amendment and Removal Process

components.cBody: Provides an overview of the collateral application form submission process, which includes location, involved stakeholders, and the next phase.
Provides a collateral application form template to be used in the submission process defined in MIP6c1.
A process component that defines a method and template to amend the collateral application form template defined in MIP6c2.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP6 defines a standardized application form used to kick off the process of onboarding a new collateral asset to the Maker Protocol.
items.paragraphSummary: The purpose of this proposal is to standardize the collateral onboarding application template that community members and third-party projects can use to begin the process of getting their collateral onboarded to the Maker Protocol.
items.title: Collateral Onboarding Application

components.cBody: Describes the various domain teams and their responsibilities as they relate to the collateral onboarding process.
A list component that is kept up-to-date with the currently ratified domain teams.
A process component that defines a method and a template that allows the onboarding of domain teams.
A process component that defines a method and a template that allows the offboarding of domain teams.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP7 defines processes for onboarding and offboarding domain teams.
items.paragraphSummary: The Domain Teams Onboarding & Offboarding proposal provides a predictable framework for both onboarding and offboarding domain teams required for the collateral onboarding process.
items.title: Onboarding and Offboarding Domain Teams (Collateral Onboarding)

components.cBody: Defines the domain greenlight process and its interaction with the collateral onboarding process.
Defines the possible outcomes from the domain greenlight process.
Defines the responsibilities of the domain teams in the domain greenlight process.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP8 defines the process by which domain teams signal that a potential collateral type is worth investigating its inclusion in the Maker Protocol.
items.paragraphSummary: This proposal defines the process where at least one domain team from each domain (Risk, Smart Contracts, Oracles, Legal, etc.) "Greenlights" the collateral type (based on research) in order for the collateral onboarding process to proceed.
items.title: Domain Greenlight

components.cBody: Defines the community greenlight process and its interaction with the collateral onboarding process.
Defines the possible outcomes from the community greenlight process.
Defines the responsibilities of the Governance Facilitators in the community greenlight process.
Defines a governance poll template to be used in the on-chain Community Greenlight poll.

items.sentenceSummary: MIP9 defines the process by which MKR Token Holders can signal their judgment on the value of a potential collateral type before domain teams spend time thoroughly investigating its inclusion into the Maker Protocol.
items.paragraphSummary: This proposal aims to standardize the process for allowing MKR Token Holders to inform the Domain Teams of their preferences for collateral types that have been proposed through MIP6. The preferences of the MKR Token holders are expressed in the form of an on-chain governance poll. The governance polls (Community Greenlight polls) are published at the start of the first and third weeks of the governance cycle and will run for a period of two weeks.
items.title: Community Greenlight
